title.@value: Altered pattern of family relationships in childhood

definition.@value: Departure of a family member or arrival of a new person into a family resulting in adverse change in child's relationships. May include new relationship or marriage by a parent, death or illness of a parent, illness or birth of a sibling.

label.@value: Altered pattern of family relationships in childhood
problem of negative life events in childhood of altered pattern of family relationships
altered pattern of family relationships affecting child
Problem of birth of sibling affecting child
